item.title: 日经新闻》称日产考虑将部分国内生产转移至美国
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周六报道，随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）加大对全球各国征收贸易关税的力度，日产汽车公司正在考虑将部分美国本土生产的汽车转移到美国。【原文：Nissan Motor is considering shifting some domestic production of U.S.-bound vehicles to the U.S., the Nikkei reported on Saturday, as President Donald Trump ramps up trade tariffs on nations worldwide.】

item.title: 富士康第一季度收入创历史新高
item.description: 全球最大的合约电子生产商、苹果公司最大的 iPhone 组装商台湾富士康周六公布，其第一季度收入增长 24.2%，创下历史新高。【原文：Taiwan's Foxconn , the world's largest contract electronics maker and Apple's biggest iPhone assembler, reported on Saturday that its first-quarter revenue jumped 24.2% to a record high for the quarter.】

item.title: 受贸易战影响的法国干邑制造商因特朗普的关税政策而陷入困境
item.description: 克里斯托夫-菲柳（Christophe Fillioux）的家族酒庄位于法国西南部的干邑地区，历经五代人的努力，经历了战争和金融危机的洗礼。不过现在，他已经开始将一些葡萄园连根拔起。【原文：Christophe Fillioux's family estate in the cognac region of southwest France has survived for five generations, through wars and financial crises. Now, though, he has started to tear up some of his vineyards by the roots.】

item.title: 美国加征关税引发股市大跌，中国称 "市场已经发声
item.description: 中国周六表示，"市场已经发出声音"，反对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收关税，并呼吁华盛顿在全球市场对贸易征税做出剧烈反应后进行 "平等协商"，因为贸易征税招致了中国的报复。【原文：China said on Saturday "the market has spoken" in rejecting U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs, and called on Washington for "equal-footed consultation" after global markets' dramatic reaction to the trade levies, which drew Chinese retaliation.】

item.title: 美国开始征收特朗普新的 10%关税，打破全球贸易准则
item.description: 美国海关人员周六开始对来自许多国家的所有进口商品征收唐纳德-特朗普总统单方面提出的10%的关税，并将于下周开始对来自57个较大贸易伙伴的商品征收更高的关税。【原文：U.S. customs agents began collecting President Donald Trump's unilateral 10% tariff on all imports from many countries on Saturday, with higher levies on goods from 57 larger trading partners due to start next week.】

item.title: 微软人工智能首席执行官的讲话被支持巴勒斯坦的抗议者打断
item.description: 微软人工智能首席执行官穆斯塔法-苏莱曼（Mustafa Suleyman）在周五举行的科技公司 50 周年庆典上的发言被一名亲巴勒斯坦的员工抗议打断，原因是该公司与以色列的关系。【原文：Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman's remarks were interrupted by a pro-Palestinian protesting employee during the technology company's 50th anniversary celebration on Friday over the firm's ties with Israel.】

item.title: 微软人工智能主管如何衡量 Copilot 在消费者中的影响力
item.description: 微软公司的前任和现任首席执行官们齐聚一堂，庆祝公司 50 周年华诞，其中一位领导人表示，他正在瞄准一个特定指标的改进，以指导他的人工智能战略。【原文：As Microsoft CEOs past and present gathered here to celebrate the company's 50th birthday, one leader said he is targeting a particular metric's improvement to guide his strategy on artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 任天堂因关税不确定性推迟 Switch 2 在美国的预订
item.description: 任天堂表示，由于正在研究关税的潜在影响，它将推迟在美国开始 Switch 2 游戏设备的预购。【原文：Nintendo said it is delaying the start of pre-orders for the Switch 2 gaming device in the United States as it examines the potential impact of tariffs.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Rite Aid 考虑再次申请破产
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五报道，美国连锁药店 Rite Aid 在最近的财务重组未能使该连锁药店走上可持续发展的道路后，正在权衡再次破产的可能性。【原文：U.S. pharmacy chain Rite Aid is weighing a possible repeat bankruptcy after its recent financial restructuring failed to put the drugstore chain on a sustainable path, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.】

item.title: 马斯克与 OpenAI 的陪审团审判将于明年春季开始
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）对 OpenAI 提起的诉讼将于 2026 年春季由陪审团进行审判，主审此案的联邦法官周五做出了这一决定。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk's lawsuit against OpenAI will go to a jury trial in spring 2026, the federal judge presiding over the case decided on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道信中说，如果受到特朗普关税的打击，飞机供应商豪迈特可能会停止订单
item.description: 据路透社看到的一封信称，为空客和波音制造的飞机提供零部件的豪迈宇航公司（Howmet Aerospace），如果受到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布的关税影响，可能会停止部分货运。【原文：Howmet Aerospace , which supplies parts for planes built by Airbus and Boeing , may halt some shipments if they are impacted by tariffs announced by U.S. President Donald Trump, according to a letter seen by Reuters.】

item.title: B.莱利公司因年度报告延迟收到纳斯达克通知
item.description: B.Riley Financial 周五表示，由于年度报告提交延迟，该公司已收到纳斯达克的拖欠通知函。【原文：B. Riley Financial said on Friday it had received a delinquency notification letter from the Nasdaq following a delay in the filing of its annual report.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 受壳牌冲击的市场为更多关税风波做好准备
item.description: 在美国股市经历了自五年前冠状病毒危机爆发以来最糟糕的一周之后，唐纳德-特朗普总统全面征收进口关税的影响令投资者惶惶不安。【原文：Tariff-stunned markets face another week of potential tariff turmoil, with fallout from President Donald Trump's sweeping import levies keeping investors on edge after the worst week for U.S. stocks since the onset of the coronavirus crisis five years ago.】

item.title: 交易日：特朗普关税让华尔街损失 5 万亿美元
item.description: 熊、恐惧和眼泪【原文：Bears, fears and tears.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Meta 计划在威斯康星州实施近 10 亿美元的数据中心项目
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五报道，Meta Platforms 公司计划斥资近 10 亿美元在威斯康星州中部建立一个数据中心项目，作为其人工智能技术投资的一部分。【原文：Meta Platforms is planning on spending nearly $1 billion on setting up a data center project in central Wisconsin as part of its investment in artificial intelligence technology, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，在中国表示将因关税问题拒绝交易后，TikTok 交易被搁置
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布对等关税后，中国表示不会批准分拆 TikTok 美国资产的交易，因此该交易被搁置。【原文：A deal to spin off the U.S. assets of TikTok was put on hold after China indicated that it would not approve the deal following President Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs announcement, according to two sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道SpaceX和ULA有望在五角大楼关键发射项目中获得数十亿美元合同
item.description: 据两位熟悉采购决策的人士透露，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）和联合发射联盟公司（United Launch Alliance）有望在周五分别赢得美国太空部队价值数十亿美元的火箭发射合同，在未来几年内将五角大楼一些最敏感的卫星送入太空。【原文：Elon Musk's SpaceX and United Launch Alliance are expected to each win a U.S. Space Force rocket launch contract on Friday worth billions of dollars to send some of the Pentagon's most sensitive satellites into space over the next several years, according to two people familiar with the procurement decision.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，特斯拉软件工程主管将辞职
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道，特斯拉软件工程副总裁大卫-刘（David Lau）已向公司内部人士表示，他将离职。【原文：Tesla's vice president of software engineering, David Lau, has told people at the company he is stepping down, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普分享视频后，伯克希尔驳斥有关巴菲特言论的 "不实 "报道
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）周五表示，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的 "真理社交"（Truth Social）账户分享了一段视频，暗示沃伦-巴菲特支持美国总统的经济政策之后，社交媒体上有关该公司董事长涉嫌发表言论的报道是 "虚假的"。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway said on Friday that reports on social media regarding comments allegedly made by its chairman are "false," after Donald Trump's account on Truth Social shared a video suggesting that Warren Buffett endorsed the U.S. president's economic policies.】

item.title: 关税动荡冻结全球并购交易
item.description: 从华尔街到以色列和瑞典，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的新关税及其引发的全球股市抛售迅速阻碍了收购和首次公开募股。【原文：From Wall Street to Israel and Sweden, U.S. President Donald Trump's new tariffs -- and the global equities sell-off they sparked -- have rapidly scuttled acquisitions and IPOs.】

item.title: 财政部的贝森特市场下跌是 "Mag 7 "的问题，而不是 MAGA 的问题 - 塔克-卡尔森访谈
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）在周五接受塔克-卡尔森（Tucker Carlson）采访时表示，股市暴跌与今年早些时候中国出人意料地推出 DeepSeek 人工智能工具有关，而不是与唐纳德-特朗普总统的政策有关。【原文：The stock market plunge has more to do with the surprise emergence of China's DeepSeek artificial intelligence tool earlier this year than it does with President Donald Trump's policies, U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said in an interview with Tucker Carlson released on Friday.】

item.title: 投资者称，拉美资产可能会受到贸易战的提振
item.description: 拉美股票和债券可能不会成为赢家，因为到目前为止，特朗普政府的贸易战大多没有波及该地区，而贸易战却引发了华尔街市场的溃败，使投资者开始追逐非美国资产。【原文：Latin American stocks and bonds could be unlikely winners as the Trump administration's trade war so far mostly spared the region, while it triggered a market rout on Wall Street that has sent investors on a hunt for non-U.S. assets.】

item.title: 特朗普关税刺激需求担忧，炼油股跌至近两年低点
item.description: 在美国总统特朗普宣布征收新关税后，美国炼油企业的股价周五跌至两年来的最低点，因为投资者担心石油和燃料需求放缓以及炼油利润率下降。【原文：Shares of U.S. refiners fell to two-year lows on Friday in the wake of U.S. President Trump's announcement of new tariffs, as fears of slower oil and fuel demand and weakening refining margins rattled investors.】

item.title: 美国石油服务公司将受到特朗普关税和油价下跌的冲击
item.description: 分析师和金融公司周五表示，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策使供应链陷入混乱，油价暴跌又为钻探活动下降埋下伏笔，美国油田服务公司正准备迎接打击。【原文：U.S. oilfield service firms are bracing for a hit as President Donald Trump's tariffs throw supply chains into disarray and tumbling oil prices set the stage for a drop in drilling activity, analysts and financial firms said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国高等级债券发行市场出现自大流行病以来从未有过的态势
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策导致美国投资级债券的发行在本周戛然而止，但一些银行家表示，在过去的一个月里，市场压力已经显现，因为焦虑不安的投资者推低了定价。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs brought U.S. investment-grade bond issuance to a screeching halt this week, but market stress had already been apparent over the past month as jittery investors pushed back on pricing, some bankers said.】

item.title: 特朗普表示将把 TikTok 的最后期限延长 75 天
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五延长了 ByteDance 出售短视频应用 TikTok 美国资产的最后期限，并表示已经取得了 "巨大进展"，但还需要做更多的工作以获得批准。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday extended the deadline for the sale of ByteDance's U.S. assets of short video app TikTok, saying "tremendous progress" had been made but more work was needed to secure approvals.】

item.title: 美联储的沃勒稳定币为支付系统带来好处
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）周五表示，稳定币对国家支付系统来说是件好事，但他怀疑金融系统能否支持大量此类资产。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said on Friday that stablecoins are a good thing for the nation’s payment system, but he doubts the financial system can support a large number of these assets.】

item.title: 贝克休斯称美国石油钻井平台数量升至 6 月以来最高点
item.description: 能源服务公司贝克休斯（Baker Hughes）周五在其密切关注的报告中称，美国能源公司本周连续第二周削减了石油和天然气钻井平台的作业数量，尽管石油钻井平台数量已升至 6 月份以来的最高点。【原文：U.S. energy firms this week cut the number of oil and natural gas rigs operating for a second week in a row, even as the number of oil rigs rose to the highest since June, energy services firm Baker Hughes said in its closely followed report on Friday.】

item.title: 美国广播公司新闻记者称，沃尔玛考虑加入投资者集团收购 TikTok
item.description: 美国广播公司新闻记者 Selina Wang 周五在 X 上发帖称，沃尔玛正在考虑加入一个投资者团体，收购短视频应用 TikTok。【原文：Walmart is considering joining a group of investors to buy short video app TikTok, ABC News reporter Selina Wang said in a post on X on Friday.】

item.title: ISS 建议对美国银行首席执行官薪酬投反对票
item.description: 代理顾问机构股东服务公司（Institutional Shareholder Services）建议投资者对包括首席执行官布莱恩-莫伊尼汉（Brian Moynihan）在内的美国银行高管的薪酬投反对票，理由是对薪酬制定过程的担忧。【原文：Proxy adviser Institutional Shareholder Services has recommended that investors cast advisory votes against the pay of top Bank of America executives including CEO Brian Moynihan, citing concerns about the process used to set the compensation.】
